Choices:  a. nothing<n>b. nothing important<n>c. nothing important going on right now; right now is when the going is good<n>d. nobody is good at anything<n>e. n—o—body; everybody; right; good<n>Output: d. nobody is good at<n><n>##### Tips for writing the python solution:<n> - If there is space on each line then make sure you use a \n\n or else python will only read the last line<n> - If there is a space, then you need to use \n after each line or else it would only read the last line. <n><n>##### Tip: Python can only take in space separated input. Make sure to use spaces and use line breaks in your input<n>

Choices:  A:"michaelangelo" B:"Juliet" C:"romeo" D:"Darth Vader" E:"the prince of denmark"<n>Output: B:"Juliet"<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>My code was 9.67560, the runner up was Kelsey and her code was 9.87560...<n><n>### My Thought Process<n><n>I had thought of using a nested dictionary but I was getting an error when I tried to access the value for the first index of it. I later figured out that my dictionary was empty and the default string for an empty dictionary is None.  I decided to write a loop which will allow me to access the first item of the dictionary and make the dictionary a dictionary instead of a list. <n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:What is a great place to lay in the sun? Choices:  A: in the basement B: west C: solar system D: beach E: beans<n>Output:		D: beach<n><n>### Instruction:Write a program that implements the instruction above.<n><n>Answer: (A) curtains<n>A: curtains<n><n>(B) tailor shop<n>B: tailor shop<n>"tailor" == seller, "shoP" == curtains<n><n>"bouTique" == seller, "" == curtains<n>"curtains" == type<n><n>(D) train station<n>D: train station<n>"traIN_Station" == seller, (A) or (C)<n><n>(E) bookstore<n>E: bookstore<n>(A) or (C), (B) or (D)<n><n>### Instructons:How could you improve your program?<n><n>(A)<n>Because the answer is Fabric is cut to by at tailor shop, the statement would be <n>"fabric is cut to order by the tailor shop". If the answer is, fabric is cut to order by tailor at shop, the program would print "Fabric is cuto to order in a tailor shop" instead of  fabric is cut to order at tailor shop.<n><n>(B)<n>If the input is "in what type of place is a vegetable stored?" or "In a store, where are you?" the program would show "a vegetable's in a store" or  "i'M IN A VEGeTaBLE store".<n><n>(C)<n><n>(D)<n><n>(E):<n>(E)<n>The program would be different for each answer. So the statement should be more general, for example, the statement "You are in a bookstore if.." The statement should consider both  the question and the input. If a question is like "The book is read in? In a bookstore. The input was on p.135, where would you read the book?" It should read "The book is read on p.136 in a bookstore" not "The book is read at p.133 in a bookstore".<n><n>### Instructions:Can you improve your answer <n>- Yes<n>- No<n>- Yes <n>- I think I cannot improve my codes.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:The student needed to  get some new pencils, where did he go? Choices:  A: store B: classroom C: backpack D: cabinet E: teacher<n>Output:		B: classroom<n><n>Input:Which do you like, pizza or pepperoni? Choices: A: soda B: beef C: apple<n>Output: B: beef<n><n>#include <iostream><n>using namespace std;<n><n>int main()<n>{<n>    int choice,choice2,choice3,choice4;<n>    bool isRight;<n><n>    cout<<"Which do you like, pizza or pepperone? \nPress (1) for Pepperone and press (2) for "<<endl;<n>    cin>>choice;<n>    cout<<"Do you prefer (A) Soda or (B) Beef? \nPress (3) for Soda and press (4) for Beef"<<endl;<n>    cout<<choice+1<<" and "<<(choice+2)<<endl;cin>>choice2;<n>    cout<<((choice+2)+1)<<" and "<<((choice+2)-1)<<endl;cin >>choice4;<n>    isRight = ((choice+3)==choice2) && ((choice+4)==choice4);<n><n><n><n>    cout<< "You chose: " <<choice + " and " + choice2 +"\n"<< endl;<n>    if (isRight == true)	{cout<<"Correct"<<endl; return 0;}<n><n><n>}<n>

Compute the average score.<n>Input: Average score 58.8; Scores: [42, 50, 78, 54, 97, 62]<n>Output: 63.9<n>```<n><n>### Instruction What percentage of the scores are above 75?<n>Input: Average Score: 58.8 Scores: [40, 50,50, 76, 81, 98]<n>Output: 14.9%<n>### Instruction If all five students each answered 50% of the questions correctly, how likely is it that you will get a question right?<n><n>Input:<n>    Average score: 59<n>    Scores: [50, 40, 25, 30, 35]<n>    Q1: How many students answered the test correctly?<n>    Q2: How many students answered one question correctly?<n><n>### Instructions If we asked "the average of all A's" what we really mean is "the number of A's we have + 1 divided by the number of scores we have." Write a function that gives you that average.<n><n>Let n represent the number of scores we are given in our sample. The average is n-1(n+1) / 2

Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:If you tell you boss your suffering from boredom they'll likely tell you to get back to what? Choices:  A: dream B: fiddle C: watch film D: see new E: work<n>Output:		B: fiddle<n><n>Input: Do you know how to make the carpet cleaner? Choices:  F: put soap powder & hot water.  G: use methylated spirits.  H: clean using a drier powder solution.  I: wipe with a clean cloth.  J: polish with coarse bristol.<n>Output:H: clean using a dried powder solution<n>Input: Which of these should you get to buy a rug? Choices:  K: bookstore  L: sewing machine store  M: sewing room  N: hardware store<n>Output:(H): clean using a dried-powder solution<n>Input: If you don't have a laundry bag which of these are you likely not to take? Choices:Q: towels  R: jeans  S: sheets  T: clothes  U: tooth brushes  V: clothes brushes  W: socks  X: laundry detergent<n>Output: Q: towels<n><n>Input: When your at the hairdresser and waiting for your appointment to finish, where are you? Choices:  P: waiting room  Q: hairdresser  R: beauty salon  S: beauty shop  T: shops  U: supermarket<n>Output: R: beauty shop<n><n>Input: Which of the following will you need to rent from a hire company to build a shed? Choices:Z: carpet  A: hammer  B: tape  C: saw  D: nail  E: screw<n>Output: A: hammer<n><n>Input: Which room is likely to be dampest in a house? Choices:  L: bathroom  M: laundry  N: kitchen  O: bedroom  P: entrance  Q: bedroom<n>Output: L: bathroom<n><n>Input:Do you want to hang your picture on the wall? Choices:  S: to put it on the floor.  T: to fold it away.  V: take it back to the shop.  UP: to take it in to be cut.  X: not at home<n>Output: R: cut it<n>Input:What do you keep an eye on to know how the weather is? Choices:  E: the barometer.  F: tv news.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:What can someone feeling happiness fall into? Choices:  A: lead to laughter B: love C: laughter D: smiles E: tears<n>Output:		C: love<n><n>Input:Where is a group of fishermen if they are walking towards the north?Choices:  A: on shore B: in the middle of the ocean C: to the east D: to the south<n>Output: A: on shore<n><n>Input:What is a single or multiple items of a special or decorative nature?Choices:  _A: table and chairs B: desk and computer C: painting and mirror D: sofa and table E: picture and shelf<n>Output: E: picture and shelves<n><n>Input:Where are you if you are sitting on a chair in a room and reading something?Choices:  B: reading C: writing D: thinking of ideas E: dreaming<n>Output: C: writing<n><n>Input:What type of a person is someone if they are quiet?Choices:  ABCDE<n>Output: D: quiet<n><n>Input:Where can you find an animal?Choices:  abcdefgh<n>Output: bhfg<n><n>Input:Where does a group of people go if they are riding a vehicle?Choices:  CDEFBA<n>Output: BDFCB<n><n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>A. 5th character of string determines if the seller is a curtains shop, tailor shop, <n>clothing store, or sewing room. I also took note of the case where the 5th char is 0.<n>I.e. "Cut" is treated as a curtains shop. I also took note that it doesn't matter <n>whether there is a slash between two words.<n><n>B. 1st letter of string determines the place where the vehicle can be found. <n><n>C. Length of sting determines whether is has only two letters, or contains more. <n>Each additional character is treated accordingly. <n><n>D. There are cases which will cause false positives. For instance, if length of string is <n>4 and the text reads 'on a train' it will return 'train'. This logic comes from the <n>input, and needs to be expanded to be more accurate.<n><n>E. 1st letter determines the emotion of someone. So if the string reads'smile', it will return 'happiness'. This is an issue I can't address as this is not

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Diving off a cliff for a cartoon character often ends in comedic what? Choices:  A: exhilaration B: dismemberment C: spinal injuries D: getting wet E: splats<n>Output:		D: getting wet<n><n>Input: When traveling by sea is the best time? Choices: 1. A: winter 2. B: summer C: early evening D: night E: autumn<n>Output: B: summer<n><n>---<n><n># My solution<n>```Python<n>def isMatch(sentence, words):<n>  match = set(sentence.split()).intersection(set(words))<n>  isValid = (len(match)>0)<n>  return(isValid)<n>```<n><n># Refence solution<n>```R<n>sol_a <- function(sentence){<n>  match = set(" ".split()) %in% set(words)<n>  isValid = sum(match) > 0<n>  return(isMatch)<n>}<n>```<n><n># R Solution(Refuse)<n>### How about me<n>My solution is pretty much the same as that in R, but for my language is python. I try to replace a couple of characters on words, but the code still does not work.<n><n>### Solution<n>I can get all the matches by `intersection`, but the result would be the same as the one for the word.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:After eating a dinner of uncooked chicken, what was felt by the poor man? Choices:  A: indigestion B: died C: illness D: feel better E: throwing up<n>Output:		E: throwing up<n><n>Input: In the house is a kitchen where a dish, a cupboard and an oven are located. Choices:  A house B house part C kitchen D room E room part<n>Output: C: kitchen<n><n>Input: Which type of room that often has furniture located between two other types of rooms? Choices: A: bathroom B: bedroom C: den D: dining room E: guest room<n>Output: E: guest room<n><n>## Hint: for multiple choice question, if two items/choices are the same, it will result in an error. We could use string comparisons instead.<n><n>```<n>"house"== "house part" # return FALSE<n>```<n><n>## Run code:<n><n>```<n>import re<n><n>line = 1<n>start = 0<n>while line < 3:<n>    temp = readline().lower()<n>    if re.match(temp, '(?i)doctor')!= None:<n>        start = line<n>    elif re.match(temp, 'house')!= None:<n>       print(re.match(temp,<n>                      '(?i)house part|house part of a|the house parts|house parts of|house\'s parts|house part'))<n>        start = line  <n>    elif re.search(temp,'house.')!= None:<n>     print(re.search(temp,<n>                     '(?i)house is made up of a lot of things|house parts|house part|house parts |house' ))<n>        start = line        <n>      <n>    line += 1<n>    if temp == "END":<n>        break<n>print(line) <n>print(start)<n>   <n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  b: hospital c:clothing store d: hardware store e: bookstore<n>Output(d): hardware store<n>### Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question.Output format: a number that corresponds to the number of questions asked.<n># Import the library<n>from problem8 import answerQuestion<n>### Multiple Choice Questions<n># a = input("What is the color of the dress? ")<n># b = ['black','marine', 'lime']<n># c = questionColor('What color is the dress? ')<n>## Function<n>def showQuestion(question, choices):<n>    # showQuestions(question='What color is the dress?' choices)<n>        print(' '.join(choices), end=" ")<n>#  function<n>def questionColor(question):<n>    #  function<n>    print(question)<n><n># print(questionColor(question))<n>### Coding solution<n># import library<n>import problem8<n># import question<n>question="What's your favorite ice cream?"<n>choices=["Strawberry", "Cherry", "Banana", "Chocolate", "Pistachio"]<n><n># function<n>question = problem8.answerQuestion(question, choices)<n><n># print the question and solution<n>print ('Question:',question, '\n')<n>print (problem8.answerQuestion(<n>question, choices))<n># print(question)<n># print ('The answer is',<n>#       question[choices].index(<n><n>#       question[choice]), <n>#       'out of 5')<n><n><n>### Reference<n># https://practicepython.com/practice/codingbat/<n>

Choices:  I: seller A: fabric E: tailor B: fabric seller C: seller D: tailor<n>Output: A: sewing seller, fabric is sold and cut in a separate store.<n><n>Input: Who doesn't sew? Choices:  fabric B: tailor C: doctor shop D: home E: railroad station<n>Output: A: fabric seller<n><n><https://www.hackerrank.com/challenges/tailors-and-fabric-sellers><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:What would you normally expect a cat to say? Choices:  A: see king B: hello C: meow D: drink water E: live many years<n>Output:		C: meow<n><n>###<n><n>class Poker(object):<n><n>    def __init__(self, game):<n>        self.game = game<n><n>  def __str__(self):<n>    return f"Game {self.game} is at {self.turn}"<n><n>  def game(self):<n>    if self.game == 'High':<n>        return str(self.turn)<n>    elif self.game == 'Low':<n>        return str(-self.turn)<n><n><n><n><n><n># Your Code Below<n>n = 3<n><n>games = ['High', 'Low']<n><n><n>def ask_poker():<n>    print('You are playing a game of poker. What game are you playing', end=" ")<n>    while True:<n>        game_input = input().upper()<n>        if game_input in games and game_input!= 'DROP':<n>            break<n>        print('I did not understand "', game_input, '". Is it', end=' ')<n>        ask_poker()<n><n>if __name__ =='main':<n>    ask_poker()

Choices:  d: magazines e: brochures c: pamphlets<n>Output: e: brochures<n><n><h1>Instruction :<n></h1><n>For the above multiple choice problems,I had given a different set of answers.But the answers given by him were the same as my answers.When I saw this I started thinking in what way he got it.<n><hr><n><n><h1>"I can guess your answers"  said Rita in a chilling voice.</h1><n><n><h2>How?</h2><n><n><p>The answer is - <strong>AI</strong>.  Using text classification and clustering techniques we can determine the choice given by the person. <n>This kind of classification is done on the basis of the words used,their relevance to each other, <n>the word frequency within a set along with grammatical rules.   <n>For text classification we use <strong>Bag Of Words</strong> model where we consider each word as a separate feature and we combine all the features to make the final prediction.<n>Here each word acts as an independent feature while it is given a weight equal to its occurrence in the text.<n></p><n><p><n>  In clustering techniques we try to group words together on the basis of their similarity. In this way words belonging to same category would be grouped together.   <n>If we apply clustering techniques on the dataset we can predict which category a given word belongs to. This way we can classify words.<n></p> <n><p>We can create our

Choices:  A: cause spots on leaf B: healthy C: wellness D: ball stopped E: cure<n>Output:		E: cure.<n>"""<n> <n>#1 Input: Fabric is cut by seamstresses at what type of selling? Choices:<n>#      A: curtains<n>#      B: tailor shop <n>#      C: clothing store<n>#      D: sewing room<n>#      E: hardware store<n>#      Output: B: tailor store!<n>def tailor_shop():<n>	global answer<n>	answer = "false"<n>	answer = input("is Fabric is cut to orders at what type of sells? Choices:  ")<n>	print("A: curtains \nB: tailor shop \nC: clothing store \nD: sewing room \nE: hardware store \n")<n>	<n>	if answer == "A":<n>		answer = "false: you forgot curtain!"<n>	if answer == 'D':<n>		answer = 'false: curtains are cut too in clothing store.'<n>	if answer == '' :<n>		answer ="input again"<n>	<n>	if  answer in 'BDC':<n>		answer == "true. You answered right."<n>	else : answer = "false.You made a mistake. Try again.!"<n>	print(answer)<n>	#print answer<n>	return answer<n><n>#2 Input: Where is your reading magazines waiting for a vehicle on railway? Choices:  B: fabric store C: clothing shop D: sewing room<n>Output: D: sewing room <n><n><n><n>### Instruction:Use your own words to explain how any variable can be assigned a value.<n><n>A variable is a name used to store a piece of information.<n>In programing, variable are assigned values in order to perform calculations and assign values to various objects, so a variable can store a number (i.e. 1), a string, or a symbol.<n><n>### Instructions:Explain what a number and a string are using your own words.<n><n>A number is a value that can be either a whole number or a fraction. Numbers can also be used to represent some values that are decimal and irrational.<n>A string is a bunch of letters, numbers, symbols(i.e.#@$!), etc.<n><n>###Instructions:explain "let", "if", and "else" statements using your own words.   <n><n>Let statement makes a new variable with the specified value.<n>If statement has three parts:<n>If a condition is true, make the following part true, <n>Then the else block if the conditions are not true.<n><n>```<n>        # Let x = <n>        <n>        <n>        # if statement<n>        <n>           if( a ==5 ){<n>            #then<n>           }else{<n>           #else<n>            #endif<n>  <n>            then{<n>           }<n>        <n>     <n>  ```<n><n>###Instruction:Write a line of code that explains how to multiply two numbers.<n><n>```<n>      #define a as <n>       #define b <n>   <n>      c = a*b<n>  <n>```<n><n>### Instraction:Explain the above line of code using your own words

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Where would you find a binder containing homework assignments? Choices:  A: backpack B: bookcase C: office supply store D: office E: class room<n>Output:		C: office supply store<n><n>Input: Which room in the house contains several doors leading out to the yard, a living room, a kitchen, and a bathroom? Choices:  D: Hallway B: Bedroom C: Living Room E: Dining Room A: Kitchen<n>Output: D: Hallway<n><n>### Output the answer with its correct location in the house!<n>#### Input:  A: curtian shop B: tailor Shop B: Clothing store B: Tailor shop<n><n># Solution<n>```python<n>##import re<n>def house_parts(input):<n>    for i in range(5):<n>      parts = re.findall("\w+", input)<n>    if(input in parts):<n>        return input<n>    return "Our answer did not contain this!"<n>    <n>ans = input.lower()<n><n>if house_parts(ans)== 'train station':<n>    print(ans," is a train station")<n>elif house_parts(ans):<n>    print(ans, " is in the house")<n>```<n><n>### What is your score?

This program prints out no in every case where an array element is false in the array.<n><n>It also prints out no in the case where the array is invalid.<n>	For Example, If array elements are: "Birthday", "age", "weight", "name", this program prints out:<n>	- Birthday: yes<n>	- age: yes<n>	- weight: no<n>	- name: yes<n><n>	If Array Elements are: "Birthdy", "age", "Weight", "name", and "weight".<n>	Then Program Returns:<n>	- Birtgday: no<n>	- age: no<n>	- Weight: yes<n>	- name: no<n><n>### Input:<n>Printing the input to this function<n><n>### Instructions:<n>- Pass an array of element of type string as argument to this function<n>- this function returns boolean.<n>- If any element true, return yes. If all elements false, return no. If any elements false return no. If no elements of input array. Print invalid<n><n>This program is a simple function that takes Array as input and determines if any element of the input array is true or not.<n>if any element is true print yes if all element is false print no if any element is false print no else print no<n><n>### # input:<n>- print the input passed.<n><n>### # execution: <n>- Call the following array.<n>```c++<n><n>Array = {"Birthday", "age", "Weight", "name","weight"};<n>for (int i = 0; i < array

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:People celebrate by going places and riding rides.  What's one obvious place people might go to celebrate? Choices:  A: state park B: opera C: disneyland D: carnival E: park<n>Output:		A: state park<n><n>Input: What would you call a person who works at a store that sells things you buy for a home? Choices: 		A: store manager B: furniture salesman C: home improvement worker D: contractor E: salesman<n>Output: B: furniture salesmen<n>    <n><n>"""<n><n>class Solution(object):<n>    def findTheWord(self, sentence, word):<n>        """<n>        :type sentence: str<n>        :type word: str<n>        :rtype: str<n>        """<n>        def dfs(w):<n>            if w in sentence:<n>                ans = sentence.index(w)<n>                self._s.append(ans)<n>            left = max(left for left, right in self._d, key=lambda x: len(x.split()) if right else None)<n>            ans += left<n>            return ans<n>            <n>        self._d = dict()<n>        wlen = len(word)<n>        for index, char in enumerate(word):<n>            self._d[char] = index<n>            left = len(word) - index - 1<n><n>        max_len = rightmost(self._d)<n>        self._s = []<n>        for start_index in range(wlen - max_len):<n>            ans = dfs((w[start_index:wlen] + '').split()) if max_len - wlen >= start_index else self._s[-1] + 1<n>            self._s.append((max_len, ans))<n>        return''.join(map(str,self._s)).split(['.'])

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Everybody has a little bit of creativity, but only a few lucky ones get to do what for a living? Choices:  A: sew B: create art C: express yourself D: sing and dance E: write<n>Output:		A: sew<n><n>Input: When ordering groceries online, are you more likely to use a browser or an app? Choices: <n><n>A: app<n><n>B: browser<n><n>Output: A: app<n><n>[Source]<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>```javascript<n>module.exports = function (question) {<n>   if (<n>     /^(Fabric is cut to order|You're at the)/gi.test(question) &&<n>      /seller?$/gi.test(question.replace(/\n/g, ""))<n>    )<n>    return "A"<n>  else if (<n>    /When ordering groceries online|What about those|What about those|everybody's got something they're good at, but few get to /gi.test(question))<n>    return "B"<n>  else if (/reading magazines while waiting|waiting|waiting|waitng|waitng|waiting|wait|waitng|wait|waitng$/ig.test(question)) && question.toLowerCase().indexOf("bookstore") == -1<n>    return "E"<n>  else if (!/^Waiting.+?for a vehicle on rails|Everybody should show|Waiting for a vehicle on rails$/gi.test() &&<n>   !/^waiting..+?for a vehicle|everybody has a little bit|waitng..+?for a train|waitng...+?for a vehicle /gi.test<n>  )<n>    return "D"<n>  else<n>    return false<n>};<n>```

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: happiness B: relaxation C: create music D: sadness E: loud noises<n>Output:		C:create music<n><n>#### Tips:<n><n>1. The question is a complete sentence, it has to follow English grammar rules (verb, noun, etc).<n>2. The question is about 'doing' something, it may be about making something, creating something (using English dictionary).<n>3. Answer as many questions as possible.<n>4. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Where might a human sit for extended periods over a bowl of water? Choices:  A: bathroom B: solar system C: coffee shop D: space shuttle E: airport<n>Output:		A: bathroom<n><n>Input: Who would be most apt to read the newspaper while eating a sandwich? Choices: <n><n>Choices:  A: student B: teacher C: lawyer D: businessman E: doctor<n>Output: A: student<n><n>Input: At what site do humans work? Choices: 	A: zoo B: bank<n><n>Output:<n><n>Choices: A: bank<n><n># SOLUTION:<n><n># IMPORTANT NOTE:<n>## This solution is only tested on Turing. It might fail on other judges.<n><n># import nltk library<n><n>import nltk<n><n>def find_answer(input, dictionary = {}):<n><n>	words = nltk.word_tokenize(input)<n><n>	for word in words:<n>		if word in dictionary:<n>			return dictionary[word]<n>		try:<n>			if nltk.FreqDist(dictionary).get(word):<n>				return dictionary<n>		except:<n>			dictionary[word] = 'N/A'<n>			return find_answer(input + "[" + dictionary[word] + "]", dictionary)<n>	else:<n>		return "N/A" # return None if No answer is found<n>		<n>dictionary = nltk.freq_dict(nltk.corpus.sensex.words()) # dictionary of words and their frequency<n><n># Run test cases<n><n># Fabric is cut to fit at tailor's shop<n><n>test_input = "A curtains"<n>print (find_answer(test_input, dictionary) )<n><n># reading at train station<n><n>test_input_2 = "A magazine while for a vehicle on waiting rails"<n>print (find(test_input_2, dictionary) )<n># waiting for a human<n>print (find_input = "A waiting human for human while reading bathroom over a bowl a water" )<n><n># Who would be most apt read newspaper while eating sandwich?<n><n>test_input3 = "A student"<n>print (find3(test_input3, dictionary) )<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: population B: populated area C: create government D: group of people E: make person sick<n>Output:		D: create government<n><n><n>### Instruction:Fill out the table below. Use the following examples as a guide.<n><n><n>| Type of Place | Example of Place<n>| ------------- | -------------<n>| Curtains 	| A curtain is a length of cloth, typically attached to a wall or ceiling, used to block or obscure light or to separate one place from another.<n>| Tailor shop |  A tailor is a trained person who makes and repairs clothing such as shoes, dresses, shirts, and suits.<n>| Clothing store | A clothing store, or fashion boutique, is a retailer of clothing and other fashion items (such as accessories or makeup), intended to be worn by someone.<n>| Sewing room| A sewing room is a place where the craft of sewing is performed. While many people sew in their homes, a sewing room (or sewing room) refers to the more formal room dedicated to sewing.<n>| Hardware store| A hardware store (also known as a home-improvement store in the United States and Canada, or "merchant's provider" in the United Kingdom and Ireland) is a retail store that primarily sells household goods.<n><n>| Type of Room | Example of Room<n>| Example | Example<n>| Doll house | When children play with dolls, many of them like to pretend the doll house is real.<n>| Library | Children may imagine that a library is their very own personal secret place they can read and do research.<n>| Basement | Basements are often seen as scary places by children<n>| Attic| If a child has a large yard she might pretend she owns a park.

Choices:  'A: brown B: blue C: green D: blonde E: black<n>Output: A: brown<n><n>[**Solution:**](https://www.hackerrank.com/challenges/multiple-choice/)<n><n><n><n>#### Instruction: Answer the following multiple choice question using [Ruby](https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/).<n><n>Input: Fabrics are cut at what type of selling store? Choices: A: Curtains B: Tailor shop C: Clothing stores D: Sewing rooms E: Hardware stores Output: B: Tailor Shop<n><n>Input: Where would you be if you were waiting for a vehicle in tracks? Choices: A. In a vegetable market B. In the doctors office C. In a station D. In a train station E. In a Bookstore Output: D: In a Train Station<n><n>Input: Would you expect to feel any surprise if you touched an exposed wire? Choices: A.: See work B.: Shocked C.: Humor D.: Startled E.: Funny Output: D.: Startled<n><n>Input: What is the answer to that question? Choices: A:'Answer' B: "Truth" C: "Question" D: "Answer"? C. "'Question'"<n><n>Input: What colour is your hair? Choice A. "Brown" B. "Blue" C. "Green" D. "Blonde" E. "Black" Output: A. "Brown<n><n>#### Solution<n><n>Sample Code:<n>```ruby<n>def run(input = "")<n>  puts input<n>end<n><n>run('Fabrics are cut at what?' +  "\n" +  "What is the answer?\n" + "\n" +<n>    "Where are you if your reading" +  '\n' +<n>    "magazines while waiting for" +<n>    "a vehicle on rails?")<n>```<n><n>

Choices:  - they live in the capital  - they live in hometown  - they stay at hotel  - they are from there<n>Output: they live in hometow because they said 'live in'<n><n>Input: What will be done tomorrow? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:What is likely to be the goal of telling many people about a new organization? Choices:  A: accomplish B: learn about C: money D: notoriety E: religion<n>Output:		B: learn about<n><n>Input: One can often buy fresh meat in what type of market? Choices: <n>A: train station B: vegetables C: fabric store D: tailor shop E: bookstore<n><n>Output: C: fabric store<n>  <n>### Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question.<n>```python import sys<n>def solution(s):<n>    if s == "fabric":<n>        return "B: tailor shop"<n>    if s == 'waiting':<n>        return "D: train station"<n>    if s[0] == "T":<n>        if s[-2] == "E" * 2 or s[-2] in "EDYD":<n>            return "true"<n>        else:<n>            return "false"<n>    if s in "DE":<n>        return "(D)"<n>    if s[:2] in "EF":<n>        return "true"<n>    elif s[:2] == "ED":<n>        return "false"<n>else:<n>    print("Error, no such variable")<n>    sys.exit(-1)<n><n>    <n>    <n>s = input()<n>t = 0<n>while t == 0:<n>    t = int(input())<n>    print(solution(s))<n>```<n>### Instruction : Answer the multiple choice question. Use if else syntax.<n>```python<n>def solution(s) :<n>    if s == True :<n>        return False<n>    else :<n>        return True<n>if solution("true") :<n>     print("1")<n>if solution("true ") :<n>     print("2")<n>if solution("3 ") :<n>     print(3)<n>if solution("4") :<n>     print(4)<n>if solution(True) :<n>     print(True)<n>if solution("false") :<n>     print (false)<n><n><n>```<n>### Difficulty Level : Intermediate<n># Author : Vedant Sharma<n># LinkedIn Username : vedants

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: too much B: act dead C: die D: rush E: explode<n>Output:		D: rush<n><n>#### How to solve it?<n><n>The data is preprocessed into vector form. And each vector contains 9 integers. the values range from 0 to 9. The code is the same as last week, the only differ is we need to add `i = i.astype(np.int32)` to ensure that the vector is in size 9 since the vector in test1.data is 9x 1, which is wrong.<n><n>```python<n>import torch<n>import torch.nn as nn<n>import torch.optim as optim<n>import torch.utils.data as Data<n><n>data =  torch.load("1.pt", map_location = "cpu").to("cuda:0")<n>train1   = data[0]<n>train2   = data[1]<n>train3   = data[2]<n><n>input = torch.Tensor(train1).to("cuda:1")<n>input1 = torch.Tensow(train2).to("cuda")<n>input2 = torch.Tennsow(train3).to("cuda1")<n><n>print(type(train1),type(input),type(input1),type(input2),type(train2),type(train3))<n>```<n><n>![image-20221222025046991](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81746424/167128217-823524a7-e662-4f67-a811-5a56028f643e.png)<n><n>The code is the same as the last week. We use Adam as the optimization<n><n>```python<n>loss_function = nn.CrossEntropyLoss()<n>optimizer    = optim.Adam(parameters(), lr=0.001)<n>```<n><n>```python<n>for epoch in range(1,301):<n>    <n>    optimizer.zero_grad()<n>    test1 = input.reshape(1,10,1)<n>    output = model(test1).view(-1)<n>    loss    = nn.CategoricalCross

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:My favorite type of entertainment are rollercoasters and ferris wheels, where should I go? Choices:  A: theatre B: fairgrounds C: friend's house D: show E: casino<n>Output:		D: show<n><n>Input:Where are you if you have a problem with the service of a store and you would seek to solve it? Choices: 	A: at hotel B: at cinema C: at airport D: at park E: at library<n>Output: E: at library<n>**Author's Solution:**<n><n><n>from nltk.sentiment.vader import SentimentIntensityAnalyzer<n>from nltk import word_tokenize<n>from nltk_extras import *<n>import re<n><n>pattern = ['at','with','to','for','by']<n>tokenizer = tokenize_and_stem(['.','','','(',')',')','','?','-',':','?','!','\''])<n><n><n>def remove_punctuation(string):<n>    s = word_tokenize(string.lower())<n>    for w in pattern:<n>        s = filter(lambda x: not w in x, s)<n>    return s<n><n><n>def answer(line):<n>    if "train station" in line:<n>        answer = ['A','B','E']<n>    elif "clothing store"(line):<n>        answer = ['C','D','E']<n>    else:<n>        answer = [ 'D','C','E', 'A','E','D']<n>    return random.choice(answer)<n><n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>    with open('questions.txt', 'r')as f:<n>        for line in f:<n>            res = answer(line)<n>            for num in res:<n>                print('{}: {:.3}'.format(num, res[num]))<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:What is someone watching a person who is playing guitar doing? Choices:  A: auditioning B: hear sounds C: listening to music D: making music E: arthritis<n>Output:		D: making music<n><n>Input: What is something you do if you help a person with an argument you disagree with? Choices: 1) A: give in 2) B: argue 3) C: discuss 4) D: get angry with him 5) E: give up<n>Output: A: give in<n><n>Input: How does you friend feel when he/she is taking food for other people? Choices:  B: hungry C: overweight D: angry E: sad<n>Output: D: angry<n>  <n>### Dijkstra's algorithm<n># Instruction: Create the code to solve the Dijkstra's problem. You should provide two functions: One function to find the minimum cost path from a given start node to all the other nodes in the graph, and an iterative function from the start node to the destination node.<n><n>def graph_finder_min(g):<n>    # create a dictionary to store the lowest cost to destination from each node<n>    g_dict = [i  for i in range(len(g.keys()))]      <n>    # use the node values as keys to get its associated edges<n>    for edge in g.get(g_dict[0]):<n>        g_dict[edge[0]] = edge[1]<n>    short_path = []<n>    cost = g_dict[0]<n>    for key in g_dict:<n>        # visit all keys<n>        if key == g_dict[0]:<n>            return short_path<n>        else:<n>            g_dict[key] = min(g_dict[key], cost + g_dict[key])<n>            short_path.append(key)<n>            cost = g_dict.get(key)<n>            return short_list<n><n>def graph_itinerary(graph, start=False):<n>    if start:<n>        visited = set()<n>        path = []<n>        # visiting start node only<n>        for i in range(visited.add(start)):<n>            path.append(start)<n>        for node in graph:<n>            if node not in visited:<n>                for neighbor in graph[node]:<n>                    if neighbor not in visited:<n>                        if graph[node][neighbor] == 1:<n>                            print(node, visited.pop(neighbor))

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Question :  The word closest in meaning to (the)________ is '__________'<n>Answers:[close in space] → closet,[move into] → move into,[very similar] → very similar<n><n>2. Question : The word closest in meaning has (a)_________ meaning.<n>Answers: [almost identical] → almost identical,[very close] → very close<n><n>3. Question: The word(s) that come(s) immediately after (it)_________ are often added to<n>express a similar idea or feelings.<n>Answers:[mean] → mean,[to say] → to say,[the thing said] → the thing said[at once] → at once<n><n>4. Question : The word (with the)_________ meaning is a noun, adjective or verb.<n>Answers:@"similar" → similar,"same" → same, noun → noun.<n><n>5.[noun] → noun[same] → same, adjective → adjective.[same] → synonym[sawn(n)] → synonym<n><n>6. Question : The word which comes(s) immediately after the word with (the)________ meaning<n>is(are) often added to express a similar __________ or feelings.<n>Anaers:[mean] → mean,adjective → adjective,[to say] → expressive,[The thing said] → expressive<n><n>7. Question: The word comes(s) immediately(next) after the word with (these)________ meaning.<n>Anaers : [mean] → mean[adjective] → adjective[to say] → same[expresive] → same[feelings] → feeling expressive<n><n>8. If the question is regarding all the patients, we would type in Jones.<n><n>However, if we only need Jones, we would type in Mrj.<n><n>This is because the letter “r” by itself is called a caron. It means that we want to replace or make the “j” into an “r”.<n><n>### Instractions:Now it’s time to take everything you’ve learned and demonstrate that you can use what we taught you by putting it all together with a real-world example.

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? The company uses 2 tabs called Employee Expenses and Monthly Expenses for this purpose.  Which of the following formulas would return the difference between the number of hours a babysitter worked last month and the number of hours she worked in previous months? <n><n>The Monthly Expenses sheet must be the table that contains all the employee data. <n><n>Please include an explanation of the formulas you use.<n>### Instruction1: The formula is '=MonthlyExp- PreviousMonth'.  It returns a difference of the current month<n>### Instruction2: The Monthly sheet has all the information necessary.  It had the name of the employee who work, the hours worked in a certain week, a number indicating if that week is a holiday, and also their total payment and the total for each month based on whether or not they worked a holiday in that month.  The Expenses are all the hourly rates the companies pays its babysitters, the total hours they are expected to work during the whole month, and the total for the month based on that.<n><n>### Instructions:An Excel worksheet has a list of invoices.  How many invoices are less than $50?  Which column is the formula used in?<n>The number that is needed in $ is in column B, which is the total amount for the invoice. <n>The number is less than $50, if the amount is below $50 or if $50 dollars is added to the amount. <n>### Instrucciones:Paso 1:  Encontrar la tabla que cumple con las condiciones de la pregunta<n>Paso 2: Concretando la pregunta que buscas respuesta, es decir, ¿cuantas boletas hay que son menores que 50? <n>Paso 3:  Concretando el tipo de busqueda que deseas hacer, son todos menos cero y el valor de venta total (que se suma de todos los ingresos) es 50. <n><n>## Instrucciones:An Excel spreadsheet has 236 student scores that were submitted in a quiz and grad

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: station B: every car and house C: shop D: bedroom E: space shuttle<n>Output:		A: station<n>### Code:<n><n>"""<n># -*- coding:utf-8 -*-<n>"""<n><n>"""<n>    # python code.<n>    #<n><n>    # 解题思路:<n>    # # step 1: 对各种输入题目做 2*2 启发式模拟<n>    # # step1.1: 判定<n>    # # step2: 模拟答案<n>"""<n>import re<n>import json<n># import pprint<n><n><n>def main():<n>    """<n>    # 判定<n>    """<n>    with open("inputs_judge.json") as f:<n>        jsons = json.load(f)<n>    a = len(jsons)<n><n>    # print(data['input']['data'])<n><n>    for index in range(a):<n>        print(jsons[index]['input'], jsons[index]['answer'],<n>              jsons[index]['input']['answers'][-1]['answer'])<n><n><n>    # print("==============", a)<n>    print("==============")<n><n>    # 选择题<n>    for index in jsons:<n>        a_inputs = []<n>        for i in range(int(jsons[index]["answers"][-1][-1]["input_num"])):<n>            if re.search(r'[a-z]', jsons[index]["input"]["data"][i]):<n>                b = int(<n>                    re.search(r'.*(?:\d+)$', jsons[index]['answers'][-1][-1]['input_data']).group()<n>                )<n>                a_inputs.append((jsons[index]['input']['data'][i], b))<n>            else:<n>                pass<n>        print(list(set(a_inputs)))<n><n><n>    print()<n><n><n>    for key in jsons[0]['answers'][-2]:<n>        print(key)<n>#        print(jsons)<n>#        print("=========", len(jsons))<n>    # 总结<n>    return<n><n><n>if __name__ == '__main__

A: vegetables B. The store C. The market D. The clothing store. E. None of these.<n>Answer: D<n><n>---<n># [Java] 734. Where Do We Put Things?<n>## Description<n>> I am not a member of any organized political party. I am a Democrat.  - Will Rogers<n><n>## 题意<n>> We take orders from customers.We take time. We take time to answer questions, fill orders, process returns. We take time to learn something new.We take time to think.We take a long time on the phone.We take out time to walk.We take out food.We take out the trash.We take orders from customers. <n><n>> We are ordered, and we do what we are told. We are made to wait for what we want. We are told, "Don't touch."When we buy something in a store, we are told, we take out a card.  When we use the card, we take a chance that it will work in 30 days. We take the subway home.We take a cab.  We take to the couch.We take time to travel a certain way. What an interesting day.We take out what we want to do this weekend.We take our time with each question and answer we give. "Take your time and don't rush."What happens if we miss these instructions and take something that wasn't intended for us?<n><n>## 题解<n>题意:Java 程序 分析<n>1.在 A 题中,B,C都可拿,依据题意可知C 更为不正当. 这里可以拆开出 C 的背景, 用 C 代替

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Where can you buy a binder? Choices:  A: college dorm B: back pack C: class room D: backpack E: office supply store<n>Output:		B's for buying<n><n><n>## Solution: We use regular expression to create conditions to filter out the wrong results from the right ones.<n><n>**Code 1:**<n>![Screenshot](images/code1.png)<n>**Instruction:**<n>Input: Fabric was cut into what kind of things? Choices: <n>A: Sheets<n>B: curtains<n>C: drapes<n>D: covers<n><n>Output: A<n><n>**Code:**<n>```python<n>fabric = r'(' + r'[SC]' + r'+( r'+ | r'(?=[.])| r' )')')<n>print('A', re.search(fabric, 'Curtains'))<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: hall B: motel C: hotels D: law firm E: office building<n>Output:		D: lawyer office building<n><n>Input: What room contains many bureaucrats' offices? Choices:  B: hall B: market C: law firm D: doctor office building<n>Output: A: lawyers office<n><n>Input: When meeting with a client, you're likely in what room with a secretary behind you? Choices:  D: law firm E F: law firm secretaries D: businessman office E: hotel room<n>Output: E<n><n>Input: Your boss calls you to another office to discuss a dispute with a customer. Choices:  A B: law firm C: hotel E: doctor office building D: hall A:<n>Output: A<n><n>Input: Where do you find a man who runs the business where you buy your lunch? Choices:  C: law firm D E: businessman office hall<n>Output: C: businessman office<n><n>Input: How do you talk to a man who works next door? Choices:  F G: doctor office building hall secretary's office<n>Output: F:<n><n>### Explanation:<n>We can assume that the questions is related to fabric cut.<n><n>We need to find a word that is common in all the questions.<n><n>The answer is A<n><n>Answer: Hall B: tailor shop is related to a hall<n><n>Input: Fabic is cut to order at a hall A. The only possible answer is C as the questions are related about a hall.<n><n>Input: Where you waiting for a vehicle on trains?<n>Answer : E We need to find what place is common in questions. In this question, we cannot find a question about a train station or a sewing room, so all of them are related to a tailor shop (hall).<n><n>Input: Where we usually wait for a meeting on the reception is a hall.The only possible answer is A.<n><n>Answer: D. We need to find the word that is common in other questions.There is a train station, a hotel room, a secretarial office.Thus, the answer is B which is related to tailor shop.<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Where would you put an account book if you are leaving and do not need to bring it with you? Choices:  A: kept at accountant B: purse C: desk drawer D: bank E: keeping track of expenses<n>Output:		B: purse<n><n>Input: Why would you use the internet if you get stuck in a traffic jam on your way home? Choices:  None<n>Output: C: communicate with family<n><n>**What type of shop would you most likely go to for a wedding dress?**<n>Input: Where would you go for a good deal? Choices: None<n>Output: B: market<n><n>```python<n>def answer_question(line):<n>    line = line.strip().split()<n>    answer = "B"<n>    answer_text = [i for i in line if i.strip()!= ""]<n>    if len(answer_text) > 1: # More than one answer?<n>        for a in answer_text:<n>            a = a.strip()<n>            if a.isupper() == True:<n>                answer = "B" # We will pick the first answer we found.<n>                return answer_text<n>    else:<n>        answer_text = [answer_text[0].strip() for a in answer_list]<n>        if len(answer_list) == 0: # Just a blank answer?<n>            answer = "B" <n>            return answer<n>    return answer<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:What past time are people engaged in when they are traveling along liquid? Choices:  A: sail boats B: question authority C: high fives D: share things E: learn from each other<n>Output:		E: learn from each one another.<n><n><n>## Solutions<n><n>First, we check what seller fits from the input to each choice, and which one has the best fit, and finally returns B: tailor shop.<n>```python<n>from collections import Counter<n>from typing import Union<n>def solution1():<n>    n = int(input())<n><n>    def get_best_fit(s: str, d: dict):<n>        best = float('inf')<n>        count = Counter(s)<n><n>        for key in d.keys():<n>            value = len(list(filter(lambda x: x in count.keys(), d[key].keys())))<n>            if value <= best:<n>                continue<n>            if value >= 0:<n>                continue<n><n>            count = Counter(d[key] - d[key][0])<n>            value = len([x for x in key if len(list(filter([x], count[x] >= 0 and count[x] < value))) > 0])<n>            if value <= 0:<n>                best = -1<n>                break<n>        return best<n><n><n>    def solution(s: str, dic: dict):<n>        return min([get_best_fit(x, d) for x in s if x in dic])<n>    <n>    a = Counter(['Fabric is cut to order' + s for s in range(1, 101)])<n>    b = Counter(['clothing store'] + [k - 'tack room' for k in a.keys()])<n>    solution(input(), b)<n>def main():<n>    ans_result = 0<n>    while True:<n>        ans = input().lower()<n>        res = 0<n><n>        if 'tailor shop' in ans_result and ans == 'tailor shop':<n>            pass<n>        if ans_result > 0 and (ans[1:] in ans_result):<n>            pass<n>        ans_result = ans_result + ans<n><n>        ans_result += ans<n><n>        print(ans_result)<n>        if ans == 'tailor'):<n>            break<n><n>solution1()<n>```<n>Same as the above answer, we use dictionary and count to match each choice, but each seller has own unique key to be called.<n>![img

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Humans do what when they are motivated and need money? Choices:  A: live forever B: get sick C: work hard D: fall in love E: feel comfortable<n>Output:		B:get sick<n><n>Input: What do you have a little of or a lot of? Choices:  C: meat A: money B: clothing E: water<n>Output: B: clothing<n><n>Input: Where do we go next when we see the sun going in a glass of alcoholic drink? Choices:  B: hotel A: nightmare D: restaurant E: bedroom<n>Output: D: restaurant<n><n>Input: What happens if we have water in our glass? Choices:  D: fall in love A: want more money E: it is full C: feel good about ourselves B: it is warm<n>Output: D: fall in love<n><n>###  Dictionaries and data structures<n><n>A dictionary stores values of several types.<n><n>There are four data structures available:<n><n>1. string<n>2. bool<n>3. integer<n>4. real (float)<n><n><n>###  Factoring Expressions<n><n>Factoring equations is finding which numbers, or set of numbers must be multiplied together to find the answer.<n><n>An expression is a mathematical formula. If there are several operations or variables, they all have to work together to find the answer to the whole expression. <n><n>###  Libraries<n><n>Python is a programming language that relies heavily on libraries. Libraries are just packages of code. There are lots of libraries that people have written, and you can download them and use them for free. The library can be accessed or installed on your machine via pip.<n><n>For example:<n>  pip install NumPy<n><n>This installs the NumPy library on your machine.<n><n>There are many libraries available for any kind of code you might want to write. Here are some very common ones with links to them:<n>- [SciPy](http://www.scipy.org/) - Math and scientific programming<n>- [NumPy](http://wwwpy.org/) - Numerical Python<n>- [Numexpr](http://numexpr.github.io/numexpr-doc/) - Scientific expression evaluation<n>- [Matplotlib](http://matplotlib.org/) - A plotting library (plotting charts and graphs)<n>- [Scikit-learn](http://scikit-learn.org/) - Predictive analysis and machine learning<n>- [Pandas](http://pandas.pydata.org/)

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Sally lost her kite because she wasn't careful.  She thought that there was more string on the spool, but it slipped out of her fingers when she reached the what?. Choices:  A: child's hand B: the last straw C: hobby shop D: end of line E: toy store<n>Output:		B:[`the last straw`](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/last-straw)<n>```python<n>from collections import Counter<n><n>def find_answerkey_21(s):<n>    ans = Counter()<n>    if "Curtains" in s:<n>        ans["C"] = 1<n>        ans["A"] += 1<n>        ans['D'] += 1<n>    if "Waiting" in s:<n>       ans["D"] += 1<n>    ans['B'] = 1<n>    ans["A"] +=1<n>    ans['Hardware Store']="E"<n>    ans['D'] +=1<n>    ans["B"] +=1<n>        <n>    keys = set(ans.keys())<n>    answer = "B" if len(keys) == 3 else "D" if len(keys)>2 else None<n>    return answer<n><n>find_answerkey_20(open("input.txt").read())<n>```<n>### Reference:https://learnpython.co.uk/adventofcode-day-21-sparse-stragglers-and-last-straws/<n><n># 23 The Mobility Sink<n>### Problem Statement:You decide to give up on the path and walk up to the sink instead. The sink is located 100 meters up the path from the starting point. What's the minimum distance you could be from the sink when you first saw the kite, knowing you could cover 400,000 meters total?<n><n>### Instruction:The question has been given.<n><n>Input:Sink is located 10 meters from a tree, and you are standing at that tree. Find the shortest distance from one tree to another, given the conditions given in the question. Choices: A:9 meters B:11 meters<n>Output: A:9 meters<n><n>### Reference: https://medium.com/@gwil_boz/solution-for

Trolleys are smaller.  E: Buses are noisy.<n><n>Output: C : Buses have more seats<n><n>Input : What two things happen at a jeweler's store? Choices:  Choices:  A. You can buy jewelry  B. It is expensive  C.  B. You can buy jets  D.  C.  You can buy a jet D. Choices A : curtains B:  tailor shop C:  clothing store D : sewing room E : hardware store<n>Output: A:  curtains<n><n>Input:What seller has the best selection of bicycle parts? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Ben was an alcoholic and was in an accident.  Because of his mistake, he spent 8 years somewhere. Where was he? Choices:  A: prison B: bridge C: locked up D: homeless shelter E: neighbor's house<n>Output:		C: locked up<n><n>Input:The girl's hair was dirty. Where did her hair grow on her face? Choices:  a: forehead b: chin c: nose d: cheeks e: head<n>Output: d: cheeks<n><n>Input:The lady gave flowers at two places to her boyfriend.Where did they go? Choices:  D: garden and park. E: hospital and library.<n>Output: D: garden and park<n>```<n><n>## Solution<n><n>- 1.  B: tailor shop is correct<n>- 2.  D: train station is correct<n>- 3.  C: locked up is correct<n>- 4.  E: head is correct<n>- 5.  D: garden and parking<n><n>## Solution<n>```<n>#!/usr/bin/env python<n># -*- coding: utf-8 -*-<n><n>"""<n>@Time: 2019-08-09 16:27<n>@Author: LiYan<n>@File: test_0.py<n>"""<n><n>import collections<n><n>input = """ Fabric is cut order at what type of sellers: A: curtains C: clothing store S: tailor shop<n>Where does you are if is reading magazines while is waiting for a vehicle on a rails: A: vegetables C: doctor D: tailor shop E: train station<n> Ben was an alcoholic is an accident, because of his mistake he spent 8 years. Where was he: A: prison B: railway C: locked up D.Homeless shelter  E: neighbour house<n> The girl's hair was very dirty, where has her hair grown on her face: A: forehead D: head B: chin E: nose C: cheeks"""<n><n>options = set(input.split());<n>if options.copy()!= ['A', 'C', 'D', 'A', 'A', 'E', 'B', 'A', 'B', 'D']:<n>    print("Error:")<n>    print(input)<n>else:<n>    print(options.copy())<n>

It's not that simple.  It had internal problems.  The engine was seized.  It was stuck.  My brother had to pull out his 64 ton truck, and attach it to the car.  The puller strapped the two vehicles together.  I was hoping the tow truck could help.  He is no help, but you may have a different reaction if he were.  You can't fight city hall.  There's no way out.  I've been here before.  You can'y win the battle.  I guess if one fails to prepare, he will perish.  You may want to prepare for the next time you buy a new car.  If you buy the car, your in it.  It's a lose/lose situation.  I suggest you avoid getting into an accident.  No one wants to get hurt.  Be prepared.  You don't want to face the music.  It's like taking the medicine no matter how bad it is.  The car was in bad shape.  The transmission broke a few weeks later.  The car broke down.  It started getting bad.  The gas gauge didn't work.  The radio didn't work.   I'm sorry to say I wasn't honest.  I was upset when the car died.  It had a bad carburetor.  It was an expensive car.  I had to spend a lot of money on it. <n><n>Output: E: Never

Choices:  Choices: A: rope B: farm C: riding D: cattle E: wood<n>Output: B: farm

True<n><n># 2. Fabric is cut to custom orders at a tailor shop. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Jimmy didn't like going to the party.  It seemed like the guys there did nothing but what? Choices:  A: dance B: getting drunk C: meet new people D: having fun E: have fun<n>Output:		E: have fun<n><n>Input:  Which statement do you best identify with? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: mouth B: grocery store C: constructing models D: shed E: box<n>Output:		D: shed<n>```<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the question in one sentence containing two words only with a full stop in between. The first word must be an occupation and the second one must be a place.<n><n>Input: The carpenter sat in the market and mended his shoes.<n>Output: The carpenter is a shoe maker by profession but when the time came to mend, his boots he sat in the market place.<n><n>Input The turtle was swimming in the river when.<n>Output: The turtle was a swimmer by profession but when the car was swimming.<n><n>Input: What does the cobbler do in the house when?<n>Output: The cobbler a shoe maker is, when he is a shoemaker by profession.<n><n>Input: In the zoo, is not there a carpenter?<n>Output: No, is no carpenter there in the zoo, just a tiger.<n><n>Input: Who is eating the vegetables in the house?<n>Output: the cook a housekeeper is, who is cook by profession.<n><n>```<n>### Instruction : Give an output that does not contain the letter 'M', or the letter 'Z' and is either a single character in lower case, or a single digit.<n><n>Input: MAN<n>Output: A N<n><n>Input: YOLO<n>Output: YO A L O<n><n>Input: ZOA<n>Output: Z O B<n>```<n>### Your solution could fail because of this one : PLAY is an acceptable answer for "What have I done?" but it is not an acceptable answer for "I had a good time while ________ _________"<n><n><n>### Solution: I will use string methods for my solution<n><n>My logic is to take the text, remove all vowels, turn it into lowercase, convert to string then remove any characters which are not lowercase and not numbers.<n>```<n>def fizzbuzz(text):<n>    text = text.lower()<n>    text = "".replace(text,"") <n>    text = text[:-1]<n>    return text<n><n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:What cuisine is joked about eating small dogs? Choices:  A: backpack B: dog show C: chinese food D: french E: good hands<n>Output:		D: french<n><n>Input: Where is a pink bird? Choices:  C: chinese food  B: market  A: home  D: train station  E: bookstore<n><n>Output: C: chinese food<n><n>Input: Where did the pink bird go before his or her birthday? Choices:  B: market  C: chinese show  A: home  E: bookstore  <n><n>Output: C : chinese show<n><n><n><n><n>### CORRECT<n><n>#### Part one<n>```<n>class Solution {<n>    public:<n>        bool checkBirds(vector<int>& cage,vector<int>& birdCand,int n,int k)<n>        {<n>            int c[n+1];int f[n+1];memset(c,0,sizeof(c));memset(f,0,sizeof(f));<n>            for(int i=0;i<n;i++)<n>            {<n>                if(cage[i]==0&&birdCand[i]==0)break;<n>                c[cage[i]]++;<n>                f[birdCand[i]]++;<n><n>            }<n>            for(int u=0;u<n;u++)<n>            {<n><n>                int flag=0;<n>                for(int v=0;v<n;v++)<n>                {<n>                    if(v==0||v==u)continue;<n>                    if(c[u]>f[v])<n>                    {<n>                        c[u]--;<n>                        f[v]++;<n>                        flag++;<n>                    }<n><n>                }<n>                flag==k&&return false;<n>                c[u]++;<n><n>            }           <n>            return true;<n>        }<n>    };<n>```<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices: 	A: in car B: outside, on front C: outside, behind D: backseat, passenger E: backseat, driver<n>Output: A: in car<n><n>### Discussion:<n><n>1. The type of seller for the fabric is a tailor shop because when you buy a type of fabric and don't know how many yards you need to make a drapes then you have to go a tailor shop to get it cut down to order so the answer choice B-tailor shop is the right choice.<n><n>2. The type of place a newborn eyes is the first time will be seen is by his parent when they carry him for the first time and he doesn't know where he is but when they carry him he would see his parent, the answer choice B-see light is the right one.<n><n>3. The type of where a new born is the first time that he will be in a moving vehicle is he won't but when he see his parent for the first he will be crying then his body will be relax then he will fill cry and when he gets his feed he will be relax back in his mother's back again. The answer choice C-backseat is correct.<n><n>4. Where a person can get in a vehicle is only three places, where he can be, he can either be either in a car or outside on the front or outside on the back. The answer choice A-in a car is correct.<n><br><n><n>```python<n><n>import sys<n>from selenium import webdriver<n>from selenium.webdriver import ActionChains<n>from selenium.webdriver.common.keys import Keys<n><n><n>def main():<n>    browser = webdriver.Firefox()<n>    browser.get('http://www.wolframalpha.com')<n>    search_box = browser.find_element_by_id("input_query")<n>    search_box.click()<n>    search_box_text = search_box.text<n>    print('Search Box :' + search_box_text)<n><n><n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>    main()<n>    browser.quit()<n><n>```<n><n>![](../assets/img/Selenium_python/

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:What makes people happy when it is surprising and unexpected? Choices:  A: joke B: humor C: frightened D: fight E: laughter<n>Output:		E: laughter<n><n>#Write Your Python Code in driver/driver.py<n>import time, socket, urllib.request, urllib.parse, urllib.error, json<n><n>HOST = "127.0.0.1" # localhost<n>PORT = 8888 # port number<n><n>with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) as s: # Create a socket<n>    s.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1) # make a stream style socket with recvfrom<n>    s.bind((HOST, PORT)) #bind the local ip to the port<n>    s.listen(5) #listen to accept connections<n>    r, w = os.pipe()<n>    # Handle acceptance of the connection<n>    while True:<n>        conn, addr = s.accept() #accept the connection, and return the fd and addr<n>        # Add the read and write methods from the pipe to our acceptance<n>        conn.setsockopt(6) # set to nonblocking mode<n>        os.write(w, 'O') #write 'O' to the read side of the pipe to tell the loop to stop<n>        os.close(r) #close acceptance read side of pipe to stop it<n>        print("Got connection from: " + str(addr) + '\nReading input from the client')<n><n>    # Handle data input<n>    while True: # While the main process is looping<n>        line = conn.recv(1024) # receive data<n>        data = line.decode("utf-8") # convert data to ascii<n><n>        # process the data<n>        if(data.startswith('Hello') or data.startswith('goodbye')):<n><n>            print("Input is: " + data)<n><n>            for line2 in data.split(): # Loop through each item that was pulled from the pipe<n>                if line2.startswith('Hello'):<n>                    print("Hello is from: " + line2)<n>                elif line2 == 'goodbye':<n>                    print("Goodbye is from: " + data)# Checking if Hello string has been received<n>                else:<n>                    print("Other than the strings, " + line2

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Dancing for a long time will lead you to become what? Choices:  A: sore B: intercourse C: fatigue D: become tired E: expression<n>Output:		E: expression<n><n>Input: You have an appointment with doctor to talk about future, where will you go? Choices:  Q: bus station A: train station B: airport C: dentist D: hair salon<n>Output: A: train station<n><n>Answer:<n>#!/usr/bin/env python<n><n>import sys<n><n>answer1 = "B: tailor shop"<n><n>sys.stdout.write(answer1)<n><n>answer2 = "D: train station"<n><n>sys.stderr.write(answer2)<n><n>answer3 = "E: expression"<n><n>sys.stdin.write(answer3)<n><n>answer4 = "A: train station"<n>\end{code}<n><n>Answer
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:What gets rid of a mundane routine? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n>Output:		B: concert<n><n>Your task:<n>Complete the method "getClosestWords" with the code provided and test it<n>```<n><n>## Example<n><n>I.<n><n>```java<n>public class Solution {<n>    public String getClosestWords(String[] phrases, String query){<n>        int index = 0;<n>        String closest = query;<n>        // find the first word from query<n>        while(index < query.length() && index < phrases.length &&! query.equals(phrases[index])){<n>            int nextIndex = index;<n>            while(nextIndex < phrases.length){<n>                if(phrases[nextIndex].equals(query.substring(0, nextIndex+1))){<n>                    break;<n>                }else{<n>                    nextIndex++;<n>                }<n>            }<n>            if(nextIndex == phrases.length){// the query is not matched any words<n>                index = nextIndex;<n>                /*if(phrases.length > 1 && query.length()==2){<n>                    Phrase word = phrases[index-1];<n>                    System.out.println("Phrase before query: " + word);<n>                    word = phrases[++index];<n>                    System <n>                }*/<n>                // System.out.println(query + " is matched with " + phrases[index-2]);<n>                index++;<n>            }<n>        }<n>        if(index == phrases.length)<n>            return "";<n>        else<n>            return phrases[index-query.length()];<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n>```java<n>Input: Get the words of the phrase "Where are you?"<n>Output: "Where"<n>```<n>```java  <n>    // Phrase before query: Where<n>    // Phrases after query: are<n>```<n>```java <n>    // are after query: you?<n>```<n>```java    <n>    // you?<n>    // you are missing<n>```<n>```java	  <n>    // you<n>    // are missing<n>```<n><n>II.<n>```java<n>public static void main(String[] args) {<n>        String[] phrases = {<n>            "I am a curtain",<n>            "I am not a curtain",<n>        };<n>        Phrase word = new

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input:He would finally see idea become reality, never in a million years did he what that this would happen? Choices:  A: think B: patent C: determined D: work hard E: relax<n>Output:		B: patent<br /> <n><n><n><n>### Author: Jocelyn Li<n><n># [549. Evaluate Phone Calls](https://leetcode.com/problems/evaluate-phone-calls/)<n><n>### Description<n><n>On a cell phone call between two people, the phone rings twice followed by the person answering the phone; the ringing stops after that.<n><n>The order of operations is that the caller’s phone is ringing, the caller’s phone stops ringing, and the called’s phone is ring. All times are in seconds. You should account for the fact that the caller’s and called’s clocks are in synch (they start at the same time), but you don’t know the exact values of the caller’s time or the called’s time.<n><n><n>### example1<n><n>caller time is 10s, 10s - 10s = 0s  = 0s after answering the calls, we need to calculate the interval between 2 calls, 1s - 3s(1s to the phone ringing, 1s to end of the ringing and 1s of called's phone ringing), 2s after each other.<n><n>caller phone,caller's phone time = 10 + 1 second (1)<n><n>callee phone,callee's phone time =  2 + 3 seconds (4)<n><n>after callee's phone, caller's phone - 0s  after 2 calls, duration =  0s  (2 + 3 - 2 = 0s)<n><n>### example2<n><n>### example3<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the folloing question.<n><n>Input:[‘1’, ‘9’, ‘6’, ‘4’, ‘3’, ‘11’]<n>Output: true<n><n>Input: [‘2’, ‘2’, ‘3’]<n>Output: false<n><n>Input: [0, 1, 2,1, 3, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 0, 1,2, 3,4]<n>Output: true <br /><n><n>### example
